tool.name: SAGA.grid_gridding.8
tool.description: Grid Cell Area Covered by Polygons
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPOLYGONS False isArrayTARGET_TEMPLATE False output_data_AREA $output_data_AREA name SAGA.grid_gridding.8 POLYGONS $POLYGONS METHOD $METHOD OUTPUT $OUTPUT SELECTION $SELECTION TARGET_DEFINITION $TARGET_DEFINITION TARGET_USER_SIZE $TARGET_USER_SIZE TARGET_USER_XMIN $TARGET_USER_XMIN TARGET_USER_XMAX $TARGET_USER_XMAX TARGET_USER_YMIN $TARGET_USER_YMIN TARGET_USER_YMAX $TARGET_USER_YMAX TARGET_USER_COLS $TARGET_USER_COLS TARGET_USER_ROWS $TARGET_USER_ROWS TARGET_USER_FITS $TARGET_USER_FITS TARGET_TEMPLATE $TARGET_TEMPLATE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_AREA $OutputSection_AREA.outputType_AREA transmissionMode_AREA $OutputSection_AREA.transmissionMode_AREA

param.name: POLYGONS
param.label: Polygons
param.help: Polygons The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json

param.name: METHOD
param.label: Method
param.help: Choose cell wise, if you have not many polygons. Polygon wise will show much better performance, if you have many (small) polygons.

param.name: TARGET_USER_COLS
param.label: Columns
param.help: Number of cells in East-West direction.

param.name: TARGET_USER_ROWS
param.label: Rows
param.help: Number of cells in North-South direction.

param.name: TARGET_TEMPLATE
param.label: Target System
param.help: use this grid's system for output grids The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_AREA
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_AREA
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool calculates for each grid cell of the selected grid system the area that is covered by the input polygons layer.
